review_title: Extremely lucky to be a part of Crown!
pros:
I was eagerly waiting to be a part of Crown and I've finally made it. I'm pleased to be a part of Crown's workforce and the culture here has exceeded all of my expectations.

- Salary is MUCH MORE than the market rate
- Clear and concise onboarding training
- Clarity in communication about the work
- Crown is RAPIDLY progressing so there is a huge scope for growth and career progression
- Your work-life balance is respected
- People are very collaborative and helpful. The inclusion in the workplace is near perfect
- You get to work with genius minds
- Crown's clients are BIG players in the market like Coke, Pepsi, etc. This is powerful presence
- Opportunity to produce ideas and the team will listen all agog
cons: No company can be perfect as it is still growing as they are setting up manufacturing plants all across the globe. So, the processes are being laid out but the perspective is to not get hung up on what's not going perfect but to focus on grabbing the opportunity and responsibility to make it as optimized as you can. This mindset is appreciated in fast-growing companies like Crown.

pros: Stable business with significant growth in last years Good pay for shop floor workers Continuous investments in new facilities and production lines
cons: Middle management pay is not worth it for expected work hours and commitment Higher management at European level lack strategical thinking and don't value their workforce

pros: Committed to your future and a very high skill level throughout.
cons: None so far. Very professional

job_title: Chemical Process Operator in Peterborough, England
pros: I have been working for Crown Holdings for 1 month and loved every minute of it. I am highly impressed at the world class training. Everyone at all levels are very warm, welcoming and approachable. The facilities and amenities are first rate. Since day 1 I have really enjoyed the induction, training and the chance to work and learn alongside the company's experts. I highly recommend this company to everyone of all ages and all levels of experience.
cons: Nothing to report, I'm really enjoying it.

pros: great pay, benefits, and schedule if your not scheduled for overtime every week
cons: Overtime, management sucks (company men don't care about employees), can be toxic depending on the person you are.

The people are great and there is a lovely feel in the office and site generally.

bonus scheme

There is a social club on site with large TV and games console, table tennis, table football and snooker and pool tables. BBQs are held in the patio space

Free coffee and tea facilities and subsidised canteen offering hot and cold food options.

easy work ethic - away from the company production so there is little stress or urgency that can come with production.

reamwork!

pros: Perhaps abroad and anywhere in the building but the Finance floor at the moment.
cons:
Worst display of human decency 

This was the worst display of human decency: 

A current young and apparently inexperienced micromanager had no clue what he was up to when he dismissed a coworker on "behavioral grounds" at his arrival. 

Funny is how they seem to experience the same behavioral issues each and every time a new worker is hired. Yet, this management refuses to do a self reflection.
Just as the issue lies with the wicked witch who only longs for her longevity and rather destroys Snow white, this person refuses to doing a heart check and does not self reflect for the longevity of the whole team. 

Empty promises will be made to reel you in and quickly out the window they will be once hired. 

This manager is in need of someone that has little to no life, no other responsibilities and one to respond at every command. Someone easy to patronize and remains quiet when yelled at. 

Facts..
Turnover is surprisingly high

review_title: Incredibly stressful place to work.  Brutal work schedule.  Did I mention the STRESS....
pros: Good pay and benefits for both salaried and hourly employees.
cons: The work schedules of 12 hour days are soul destroying. The overnight shift is especially brutal and most of my employees were working on only 5 or 6 hours of sleep daily. This was not good for morale, performance or health. Additionally, the plant was only staffed at 85 or 90% so we cover those open positions with overtime. This was great if you liked to work OT but it was a never ending cycle of working on your days off. Big paychecks but no life away from work. I had some great experiences and met some wonderful people at Crown, but ultimately the stress forced me to leave. It is actually a good company if you handle the stress that comes with the job.

pros: This has been the best company I have worked for. When I began there was a clear indication of where the leadership saw my position going and the potential for upward movement if I was willing to strive for it. Anytime I have a question or need support with a project, I can always find someone who is willing to help me. One of the things that really help to make my decision to work here was the compensation and benefits each employee has the opportunity to obtain. In addition, the emphasis of having an equal work-life balance is something I am grateful for.
cons: There is a lack of diversity among those in key, senior leadership positions. It would be nice to see more women or ethnic diverse men/women in those positions. There is also isn't a feeling of being one company, there are so many segments under each division and company that it doesn't always make it feel like we are working together towards the same goal. In addition, it does sometimes feel like we are still working off of the same procedures that were in place decades ago and they have yet to be updated to conform with the younger generations coming into Crown. The company culture seems like it is stuck in the 60s or 70s out of fear of making a change.

pros: Start pay is good for the area.

review_title: Great for those ready to retire or just starting out
pros:
This company offers great benefits and is a great place to end your career. If you have years of experience and want somewhere that hasn't changed in about 25 years, this is the place for you to sail into retirement.
If you have little experience and a college degree and want to get your foot in the door somewhere that will be impressive to others in manufacturing industry, this is the place for you to get a good foundation.
Will allow you to know how to handle many things you would never learn at other companies, because they keep hiring for professional positions down to a minimum.
cons:
If you are young, ambitious and looking for a career to fill the years between entry level and retirement, this is not the place for you.
Do not appreciate high performers if your demographics do not match up with the majority of this company. 
Very little opportunity for advancement
Very little diversity, employee relations events, and emphasis on positive work/life balance
Inundated techniques, policies, procedures and technology
Poor communication across divisional lines

pros: Good for human resources, taking care of its employees.

pros: atmosphere is a great place
cons: People are very nice and fun

pros: I've been employed by Crown for less than a year. The particular facility where I work is undergoing a great deal of change. While change can be uncomfortable for many, it is an essential element of any business or industry. I believe that our facility manager has a proven background in driving change. I am goal oriented person. Therefore I can appreciate the "Big Picture." I enjoy using creating and using metrics to track improvement.  I look forward to helping make my facility the best in the corporation.
cons: Being the proverbial "People Person, I don't enjoy seeing certain employees being made unhappy by their own short-sightedness or lack of flexibility. Unfortunately with the aforementioned change, there will be personnel changes that not all will agree with. With the many tasks at hand come long hours. Although I am comfortable that the result will be worth the labor, I still miss time with family that has been replaced with more time at work. Another con would be that policies and procedures have been changed and not documented over the years. This makes roles, responsibilities, actions, and consequences vague and ambiguous.

review_title: An unethical company that also lacks empathy towards its workforce
pros:
Worked for Crown for over 10 years. Was fortunate to work with a number of colleagues that were from the days of Metalbox which provided me with so many skills and experiences that have proved invaluable to my career.

The workforce made it a very unique place. It was a very proud workforce that naturally loved manufacturing the plants range of products.
cons: Please do not think that I do not like change, if change is for the better then I shall gladly embrace it. What we witnessed was not only unethical but on occations criminal! We witnessed a senior executive manager kick a notice board over in rage, narrowly missing someone as it fell. Verbal abuse by the senior managmemt was common. We witnessed racist and religious discrimination on a number of occasions. Witnessed an individual have a mini stroke due to the stress and unacceptable behaviour from the senior managmemt, which was clearly supported at boardroom level. The workforce sickness went through the roof due to this behaviour. Local politicians, high level individuals with the media, unions and Crown itself were all made aware of what was going on in factory. It is now in the middle of being decommissioned. If the place didn't have a future then that is fine however there is no need to treat a loyal workforce the way they did.

review_title: Great benefits but behind the times, poor departmental management
pros: Friendly, community culture. Excellent compensation. Excellent medical benefits, including dental. 401k and pension plan. On-site cafeteria. On-site gym free to all employees. Frequent raffles and employee appreciation events. Long established company with stability.
cons: Women will be subjected to occasional sexual harassment, although if it is reported to HR, it will be addressed. Poor leadership in graphics department. Graphics department is behind the times and disorganized, still can't get it together in terms of process. Employees are pitted against each other and targeted. Employees' job performance will be discussed by manager to other employees in the department, and employees will be asked to keep tabs on other employees by the manager.

review_title: Solid employer, makes products everyone uses
job_title: US Corporate Office in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Safety is taken very seriously, with support coming directly from upper management. 

Excellent benefits (FULL PAID medical, dental, vision, prescription), retirement (401k match plus company paid PENSION), tuition reimbursement, promotional opportunities.

Employees are very knowledgeable and experienced in their professions. Workforce is stable and typically stays for a long time. Plant employees, management and senior leadership all pull their weight.

As well as the company makes money now, there is still a lot of potential for improvement.
cons: Sometimes changes happens slowly. Crown needs also stay agile to take advantage of new opportunities. Very lean management structure can make it hard to earn promotions, but promotion from within is encouraged by leadership.

pros: Overall the people are good to work with, the experience level here is through the roof as many have been here for two decades or more. They are also very willing to help and share their knowledge with those who ask questions about issues. Once the people know that you are there to work and have the company's best interest in mind, they are all in to support you. The majority of the time, meetings are light hearted and goal oriented.
cons: The cons are the culture is very tribal knowledge based and very few SOP / document control based. This is can be an issue with so many looking to retire soon.  Also with change comes resistance until you have more buyin from everyone, this takes time and the patience of a saint.

review_title: Cushy job but not a dynamic place to work
pros: Good benefits such as free gym/ gym classes, canteen, generous corporate bonus if exec level, good holiday allowance and flex time options. Opportunity to travel is a bonus.
cons: Your experience can very depending on your manager. The crown CT bubble is out of touch with modern industry. many staff members have long service records and lots are out of touch with the outside world. Lots of seniors have only ever worked for Crown and have narrow fields of vision. Things can move very slowly and progression is often limited. Negativity can drag you down and the mismatch in work ethic between coworkers can be demoralizing.

pros: You will make above average semi-skilled wages and also be given above average benefits.  You are employed by an American owned company in business since 1892.
cons:
Their customers have put a gun to their head and forced them to relocate their manufacturing plants to Mexico.  They have decided to run their American plants into the ground, while abandoning their aging workforce and equipment.  
Mexican labor is much cheaper.  Crown wants to be reborn in Mexico with newer tools and younger people.

review_title: Stable company, good pay and benefits
pros: Excellent benefits including free medical for employees (no monthly premium). A  great career path if you are a hard worker and apply yourself. People stay for a long time, and there are lots of stories of people spending their careers at Crown. The company makes products people use everyday, which makes you feel very connected to what we do here. In the current environmentally conscious world, plastic packaging has such a bad rep, that it's nice to be part of a company and product (metal packaging) that is very sustainable.
cons: Can be slow to change or adopt new ideas. Updating our systems would be a big opportunity. Some long-term employees are having difficulty adapting to the open floorplan in the new office, which is standard for companies nowadays.

pros: The company offers great benefits and a pension plan. They are big on promoting within, so there are plenty of opportunities for growth and movement within the company.
cons:
The hours are 8:30 - 5, and they offer no FLEX time, which makes it difficult to maintain good work/life balance, especially for those with children. In general, it seems like most of the employees are under paid in comparison to similar positions at other companies. 
In terms of time off, you start out with 2 weeks vacation. You have to work there 5 years before you get a third week of vacation and 15 years to get 4 weeks vacation - which is the max. All vacation is "use or lose" within that calendar year and there are no personal days.

job_title: Production Tech in Sugar Land, TX
pros: 4 on 4 off, insurance, medical, dental, vision, paid vacation, pension, retirement
cons: Mandatory overtime. Even if you plan something months ahead of time theres no way to get out of mandatory overtime. Even vacations arent set in stone. The way they do raises is ridiculous. If you have enemy's on the committee you can bet you wont get a raise. Unrealistic time frame for completing projects. Crown will not spend money to get things fixed, mainly just "make it work" attitude. Managers dont care about your opinion. Most of the managers have no clue how the plant is actually ran or how the process of can making is done. It's all about production and why it's our fault we arent meeting goals.

review_title: A decent place to work for my first thirteen (13) years, then everything at Plant #058 changed for the worst.
pros: For semi-skilled work, the pay and benefits were decent.  The other workers were mature and easy to get along with.  It was nice to have a lot of days off, since we worked twelve-hour shifts only three or four days each week.
cons: Crown Cork and Seal is an old American manufacturer headquartered in an old American city (Philadelphia).  At Plant #058 in Aurora, IL, many of the production machines were designed and built back in the 1950's.  This company is getting hammered by state-of-the-art, foreign competition.  If you are offered a job there, it's probably because they just fired another poor fellow who couldn't handle a sudden doubling of his work load.  My advice is to not get on board this sinking ship.

pros: Crown Toledo has some great people to work with, and the work is easy for the maintenance department. The benefits here are 'meh'. They do offer a small pension after four years of service, which is better than other companies offer. Their health insurance is paid for by the company and they offer tuition reimbursement for improvement. After two years employees receive 60% of their pay during layoffs.
cons: There isn't any room for advancement. What you're hired in as is what you'll stay.  Work can be slow fairly frequently with reduced hours - prone to layoffs. If you haven't made your two year mark it can be tough to get by when work is slow.

pros: Location is great.  Working atmosphere is fairly relaxed and conducive to working hard without excessive pressure.  Management at the Holdings office really knows what they're doing.
cons: Dealing with colleagues in different business units at offices in other countries / timezones can be a real drag when their English is not up to par.  Colleagues in certain countries seem to make the same mistakes over and over again.

pros: Pay is good for exempt employees and the benefits are excellent. The company strongly believes in making sure employees are fully trained in their positions at the corporate level.
cons: Hostile work environment in some of the field locations and unprofessional leadership in some of the field locations. There is no support from management and management sets up employees to fail.

review_title: Good company for white males, all others look elsewhere...
pros: Good benefits (though salaries are awful). Some locations are better to work at than others.  There are some decent people working there outside of management.
cons: Worked at the Alsip Technical Center.  Pros/Cons are very location dependent, but strongly advise against working at the R&D location.  Extremely political environment, where political games are given higher priority than what is best for the company or its employees.  Toxic work environment.  Definitely a boys club.

review_title: Not a good place to work if you have a family.
job_title: Chemical Process Operator in Bradley, IL
pros: Crown Cork & Seal makes a quality product and is very concerned about safety and using quality  materials to make high quality product and continues to renovate there factory to improve productivity.
cons: The wages are lower than other factory jobs in the area. Training is lacking in many areas of the factory. Required to work most holidays! The last year I worked there I worked all but one of the eight annual holidays.

pros: Company Gym, Full service kitchen
cons: No flex time. Management is sub-par. Asked to work "mandatory" over time but not get paid for it. Take on multiple projects to only get a below average raise.

review_title: Watch your back and make sure your white
pros: Workers were great, pay was above, benefits, gain share were good
cons:
Quick to move someone out because of their skin color.  Will fire you over the phone or through Facebook Messenger.  Work every major holiday including Thanksgiving...except management.  

Make sure you are safe, Unless your in management...then please turn the other direction.  

Superintendent doesn’t come out of his office and HR doesn’t see the production floor.

Favoritism is a big issue there...it is like a buddy system.  They are quick to move their buddies up.  

Don’t have to worry about supervisors watching you, because they tend to disappear, stay in the office and play on their phone, or you can always catch them screwing off in the millwrights shop.

pros: Good pay and benefits. Large company. Great if you have less than 5 years of experience and or you are new to manufacturing.
cons: Change happens very slowly.   Very lean management structure. Expect to be understaffed with with no help to get your job complete on a day to day basis.  Training for the employees and management is lacking and all important decisions are made at the corporate level.

pros:
Friendly people, great benefits and there is a lot to learn and places to grow and excel within the company.
Great documentation SOP structure and corporate intranet.
Corp involvement and vested interest in each facilities quality and safety program and well being as a whole is commendable.  Very KPI driven
cons:
1. Some KPIs do not seem to be more than paperwork and results don't seem to escalate for comparison and communication back for improvement needs.  

2. Document structure is good however document revision control across the organization could be improved if people sent links of documents to people instead of attachments.  Sending attachments allows for people to change documents and have different variations of SOPs in other areas instead of true document control and correct revision status from an audit standpoint.

3. Training is fairly good for on boarding new hires as far as the long term training of all topics.  Hands on basics at the beginning could be beneficial during the first few weeks to shadow someone.  

4. Cross training of employees and development of skill sets to allow for back ups as needed and allow managers to evaluate performance on an annual basis and be the resource to provide training as needed for skills to be more effective is missing but we will be working to improve that here.  Not sure if other plants have the same job titles, skill sets, evaluation of performance and resource needs for training effectiveness or not.  This would be helpful information.

review_title: Good company to work for.  High production environment. Not pushed or stressed too much, quite a relaxed atmosphere
pros: All positions well paid. Westfield health care provided. Plenty of overtime that is voluntary not compulsory .  Generally employees are treated really well.
cons: Good workers generally kept to lines and held back from progression with less skilled workers that are not the best moved forward.

job_title: Electrical Engineer Manager in Batesville, MS
pros: decent insurance, standard benefits. Nothing special there but not below par I suppose.
cons:
Understaffed with underpaid help. Constant resistance to spending money. Systemic resistance to change. 
They expect miracles but are unwilling to drop a dime to make anything better.
The most stressful management job I've ever had . I wish I'd never accepted their offer and I'm out of here first chance I get.

review_title: If you need employment this is the place
pros:
Excellent benefits package
People are generally good to work with 
Schedule flexibility for salaried workers
cons:
No career mobility
"Corporate" controls everything and must get 20 tiers of approval for any move
Lots of "this is the way we've always done it" rules

review_title: Good opportunities if you are prepared to make an effort and show flexibility
pros: Crown is a company where manufacturing performance is critical. The culture is down to earth with a focus on getting things done and always aiming to deliver high quality products against the lowest possible costs. The objectives are clear and straight forward and there is no interest in big business pow-wow nonsense.
cons: If you are not prepared to put in a fair amount of effort you should not consider working for Crown.

pros: Good benefits, committed to safety, overall concern and care for their employees. Many long-term employees with successful careers.
cons: Antiquated tracking systems in place and not likely to be updated in the near future. While slow to change overall, there have been recent glimpses that Crown is trying to be more of a leader and less of a follower. There are a high number of staff retiring or about ready to retire, and keeping good new/young people can be difficult.

pros: It was a great experience working at crown. I learned a lot and gained knowledge to help move me forward in my career.
cons: They have a hard time listening to employees at times. They like to run a plant with the bare minimum of employees.

pros:
- Good benefits
- Faithful and committed employees (from staff to managers)
cons:
- Limited opportunities for career advancement.
- Lack of a consistent and impartial feedback process with no actual focus on professional development and/or improvement
- Old fashioned company not open to diversity or change
- Business has been flat in North America for several years with reduction in the number of plants in US and Canada

pros:
-Good benefits and salary for an entry level 
-Overall nice environment
cons: -If you like fast paced places this is not it. Suuuuper slow. Learnt a ton in the firsts few months and then it was really just plain and a bit boring.

pros: Could be worse for sure. One of the better jobs in this area. Benefits are pretty great.
cons: Management are worthless. Safety and training are talked about like they are important but unless you are in the chosen few they don't really care.

pros: An overall good place to work.  A solid, reliable company with an established history and in an industry that is relatively resistant to recessions.
cons: Recent history of downsizing / plant closures have created a sense of unease and distrust.  A history of allowing poor manager to continue in their positions too long before applying corrective action.

pros: Crown is a progressive company!  I enjoy being a part of the team here at Crown.  We are in a commodity business yet there are still many areas of opportunity for improvements.  We pride ourselves in providing a safe work environment for our employees!  The health benefits are a step above other companies I have been associated with.
cons: Compensation seems to be lower than similar businesses.

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Large company.
cons: Terrible management.  Need training in how to treat employees with respect and dignity.  Hostile work environment especially in Unionized plants.  No teamwork between employees.  Management does not promote a safe work place.  Production is key at the expense of employee safety.  Made to work on equipment with no proper LOTO.  Would not recommend.  Never worked in a worse Hell Hole.

review_title: Struggle to with stand the boredom & the lack of any progression is depressing
pros: The position does have a good rate of pay for the job expectations, but not what I would class as a Production Engineer tbh.
cons: Don't like shift work, but that's my personal preference. Worcester plant gives the impression of a factory waiting to shut and just seeing out the last few years. Very little new business and little to no investment in facilities.

pros: Great friendly environment, easy work, simple computer skills needed, easy materials to use, and would be a great starter job for people straight out of school, works with schedules of going to school or have other job.
cons: When work slows down no work so no hours, when a temp you have to wait almost two months for badge, overtime doesn't count for hours to go full time, benifits aren't really good and not much of a pay increase when hired full time

pros:
Pay is good and benefits are better than most
Management is trying to catch up to the modern times - new improvements in communications,etc.
Improvements in goal setting and pay for performance
cons:
Very structure environment which does not allow much work/life balance.
Corporate employees are given better benefits and opportunties for advancement than the outreach plants.

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Fair share of really good employees.  Seemingly solid sales and marketing plan.  Emphasis on employee safety and well-being.
cons: Unstable management at division and plant level - drastic changes in strategy come quickly.  Negative culture for hourlies and middle managers.

review_title: Great Benefits, good people, not so proactive or growth oriented.
pros: Benefits are paid 100% by employer for employee, Safety first,  good people in company
cons: not very proactive in some divisions, growth oppurtunities and promotion of personal growth available but not encouraged in some areas

pros: I’m a fairly new employee to Crown’s headquarters location and so far received a wonderful welcome. Crown is a great company to work for. There is stability and opportunity for growth.  The people are pleasant and management is there to answer any questions. Medical Benefits are excellent. Also, the company offers wellness perks which encourages employees to be healthy.
cons: No cons at this time.

review_title: Experience from recently adquired Mexican branch
job_title: Head of Services in Toluca, México
pros: Continuous improvement culture which invites you to give your best, good compensation package for the industry, facilities well taken care of, good rewards for good performance (merit-based).
cons: Not very atractive locations, working additional hours is almost a requirement, very competitive working environment, old and tried business model so there´s not to much innovation opportunities regarding that.

review_title: Decent company,  limited room for growth.
pros: Cafeteria that has hot food breakfast and lunch. Pretty good work life balance.  Most employees are friendly.  Good for a couple of years out of school.
cons: Office politics higher than most companies. Have to be very careful what you say.   Limited room for growth.

pros: Employee benefits are fabulous.  401K and pension is unheard of now-a-days.  Health benefits are very competitive.  The company is very flexible when it comes to personal matters and really makes one feel secure.
cons: Annual salary increase is sub-par.  Pay increase barely covers inflation rate and so it really isn't a pay increase but more like a salary maintenance.

review_title: International company with great career progression
pros:
International organization with great base of senior management who are eager to engage with young talents.  It  is dynamic and great working environment.
Innovative technologies and exciting products - makes you proud to work for an industrial company.
cons: It might be slower in some specific projects. And would be great to have some innovation on internal and external communication.

review_title: Good working experience - well organized manufacturing setup with clear paths
pros: Market leader in the region. This allows the company to be able to strategize more efficiently compared to competition and resultantly enables employee motivation to evolve
cons: Not the best from a talent development point of view. Very often the strength of its length and breadth is often is its weakness as well

pros: Benefits and salary are great. They offer 401K and a pension for their salary employees.
cons: Typical office politics, but if you do your job and try to stay out of it, you should be fine.

review_title: Solid performing company, stable work environment
pros: Stable company, excellent benefits including free medical to employees and pension + 401k match, extremely knowledgeable coworkers
cons: Change can occur slowly. Sometimes there are missed opportunities if we take too long to act.

pros: Great plant leadership; cared about people, cared about safety, offered gain-share.  Great co-workers.
cons: Corporate offices didn't share enough of the wealth.  Too much corporate leadership - too many white men.

review_title: Good place to work as long as the right leadership is there.
pros: With the right leadership, this company offers a lot of opportunities for anyone willing to work hard enough.
cons: Can require a lot of hours. Also working overnight shifts in their manufacturing plants can be rough.

review_title: Good people, small cog in a big wheel type business.
pros: Good pay, with plenty of overtime opportunities.   Bunch of hard workers moving towards a common goal to make beverage cans.
cons: Not many advancement opportunities outside of the Union.  Rotating 12 hour shifts are rough, especially when you get 3 in a row.

pros: Pension & medical benefits - The only reason to stick it out, really.
cons: Poisonous workplace culture where bullying and backstabbing occurs constantly. Management is well aware that it is happening and does nothing. Rampant favourtism by management. Low-skilled/lazy support personnel. Insufficient training for machine operators/maintainers. Employee committee that ignores legitimate concerns. IT infrastructure which is decades obsolete. The most dysfunctional team I have ever worked with. I wake up everyday thankful that I don't still work there.

review_title: No company for good professionals (University graduates)
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Torres de Cotillas
pros: Get work experience to look for a better company.
cons: Be prepared to be mistreated. Your good ideas will not be taken into account, in fact your managers will copy them and use them as their own ideas. You will be fired at the slightest disagreement with your managers or if you are more knowledgeable than them. No option to move up the career ladder

pros: Salary, healthcare, 401K, Vacation, Great people always opportunities to learn more about the process.
cons: Not many challenges. Hard to know what you can do to earn a significant raise. However I may not have been there long enough to know.

pros: Working alongside a wonderful team or as a family as i like to call them. Great benefits aswell as great payers
cons: Place is coming to an end. Thirteen years employed here and to see our machinery moved abroad is sad times

review_title: Good company to work for when they get back on their feet
pros: Old school job skill trade and they take care of you without being a union
cons: They pay more attention to numbers than they do the employees.

pros: excellent benefits.  safety is a priority - they provide all the safety gear and doing unsafe practice will get you suspended, even fired.
cons: very few technically capable mechanics for the age of the machinery. very close to the corporate office so higher ups visit  overtime while good is too much.

pros: The pros of working at Crown where: outstanding pay for the amount of labor involved, The benefits package was the best available for a very affordable rate.
cons: The cons of working at Crown where: Lack of ability to make a definitive call in the event of an emergency. They would not take responsibility.

pros: Walking out door at end of shift
cons: Hard work, over stretched under paid an no value, daily grind an unhappy faces everywhere, don’t expect to leave with sole intact

pros: Crown is growing through both acquisition and expansion.  Solid, stable company with great people.  Benefits package is excellent with paid medical and a pension.  Lots of growth and advancement potential
cons: Crown is a large, global organization so sometimes things move slower than you would wish.

pros: Company had great benefits. HR needs to be looked at.
cons: The treatment of management over employees is very unfair.

pros: Easy job and decent schedule
cons: Never any overtime and warehouse is closed ever year for 3 to 5 months

job_title: Manager of Networks and Applications Integration in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Culture. People. Intelligent co-workers. Opportunities to work with projects requiring teams and team leadership.
cons: Average communication with upper level management with minimal impact.

pros: Vacation pay, overtime is available, holiday pay
cons: Unable to move up, promote employees with less experience before older employees who has been there 10 plus years, plays favoritism especially if your within the other race preferbly white, don't listen to suggestions from employees

pros:
Great environment filled with hilarious, easy-to-talk-to people
Able to do real, valuable work as an intern
Everyone is quick to help anyone with a question
cons: Engage and talk to your employees more

review_title: Ok job with no further opportunities
pros: I have been happy enough to meet very nice colleagues and the management is fairly flexible in terms of overtime.
cons: No chance to receive a pay raise or to progress in your career.

pros: Great pay, safe environment, lots of hours.
cons: Manditory overtime every week. Not enough training.

pros: Four days off, pay ok, benefits ok. Great co-workers
cons: Not open to new ideas...This is the way it's always been.   Medical cost employees alot out of pocket.  Supervisors think they are all that.  HR will not do their job.

job_title: Senior Pension Representative in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Crown was just a great place to work.  I was laid off due to out sourcing.
cons: There were no down sides in working for Crown.  It was a great place to work.

review_title: Excellent support. Management highly professional & business savvy.  I enjoyed the work & the people.
pros: Management support allows you to excel in the job.
cons: Limited opportunities for career advancement.

job_title: Assembly Line Worker in Sugar Land, TX
pros:
Good pay
Hard work
Good benefits
Overtime
Breaks
Company would provide lunch some of the time.
cons:
No loyalty
Management does not care about employees
No work/life balance
Strong chemical smell
Plant manager does not get to know the employees...just a number to him!

pros:
Pay and insurance
Most of the employees at the plant are nice to work with
cons: Corporate Office give themselves promotions and raises while they hold back the people who actually make them look good

pros: Pay is good. Receive 1.25 for overtime. Paid time off is nice.
cons: Egotistical Management! Supervisors are treated as worthless lackeys.Their ideas are suppressed until they become managers' own!

pros: Money is ok. Benefits are decent if you're Union.
cons: Management puts on a show. Will say one thing and do another. They don't value family. They continue to take anything they can from employees and pay upper management multiple millions of dollars. They will lie to cover their butts. Employee moral is never taken into consideration. Bottom line, they don't care about people.

pros: Interesting product that the company produces.
cons: No updated engineering for air conditioning the warehouse.

pros: Great pay & benefits, most of the people were awesome to work with..
cons: Upper management don't have a clue, always cutting head count to improve their bonuses.

pros: Very knowledgeable, dedicated people. I learned a lot there. Good benefits.
cons: IT is antiquated. High focus on cost control. This is a good practice, be can also be frustrating at times when decision need to be made quickly.

pros: Everyday has new challenges, great people work in the plants
cons: Corporate gives no support and corporate leadership is unaligned on almost every topic

pros: reasonable salary, good benefits and pension scheme
cons: not good for graduates since there is no structure in place, too political on the management side, bad communication among departments, less pay rise

pros: Paid medical benefits for employees.
cons: A lot of changes in recent years; pension program ended, moved to a much smaller building, and they took some paid holidays from us. Makes me a bit uneasy.

pros: competitive pay , decent benefits, company funded retirement
cons: pour management on one or more shifts, sabotage of new workers progress, and virtually no training programs, and to many clicks and trouble makers!

pros: Medical and Dental Benefits are amazing. Great team to work for and with.
cons: When promoted to a new position your salary is not what it would be if hired from outside the company

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Suffolk, VA
pros:
Advancement Opportunity
Great Culture
Clear Goals and Means of Achieving
cons: Some departments can be difficult to communicate with due to tenure and distance

pros: Flexible schedule, good work-life balance
cons:
I work at the Alsip Technical Center as a project manager (scientist) and there are not a lot of opportunities to move upward or laterally.

Poor middle management

Old boys club

pros: The wage is more than average, you have a great career opportunity and experience gained through this company
cons: The working hours extend the  8 hours per day and sometimes Saturdays are included

job_title: Front End Maintainer in Kankakee, IL
pros: The 12 hour schedule means longer days but more days off per week
cons: Low pay. Hot in summer, cold in winter

pros: Benefits are very good as well as pay
cons: Management is not in tune with hourly employees

pros: Co-workers were nice, and the opportunity to make good money
cons: if you are low man on the shift, you get stuck working MANY hours of mandatory overtime. As a result, no time for family or any personal life.  A good part of management at the plant I worked at looked down at employees.   Lots of bodies come and go, few stay.

pros:
All Holidays off paid
OT 
Stable work force
cons:
No advancement opportunities
Not enough PTO for hourly employees

job_title: Quality Assurance Manager in Omaha, NE
pros: Support from multiple levels of the organization - detailed training plan/agenda
cons: Took a significant amount of time from initial resume submittal to first interview

job_title: Quality Control Inspector in Chelmsford, MA
pros: Good pay, good team work
cons: Long hours, lack of communication

pros: Long Term Employment, Family, Good Management, Career Orientated
cons: Reclusive and Secretive, not always transparent

pros: Easy work. Clean working environment 12 hour shifts insurance paid for great co-workers
cons: Too many hours too many holidays working. Work you 14 hour shifts if someone calls off

pros: Excellent management and team work
cons: Slow in decision making process

pros: Time off 4 on 4 off shift pattern.
cons: Poor blinkered management that hide away while the moral and enthusiasm dwindles away from it employees.

pros: Flexible work hours, good working dynamic, committed employees, strong businesses within the company
cons: Could be more innovative and be willing to be open to changes

pros: pay, work life balance, decent benefits
cons: management does not communicate or train at all

pros: Good pay and some of the people aren't so bad
cons: Hours mandatory overtime. One week vacation. They say you get every other weekend off but in reality you don't. Not afraid to work you 70+ a week. Write you up when you take a day off.

pros:
Friendly and straightforward company culture 
Good employee benefit
Try to keep and grow employee internally
cons:
Moving EMEA headquarter from Paris to Zug
Not enough motivation for employee

pros: International environment and systematic approach. Focus on cost in all subjects.
cons: Palestinian leadership. Difficult to change old practice

pros: Well established procedures, good training before starting
cons: Even if you are intern, you have to be ready to work overtime during monthly closing procedures.

pros: Good learning opportunities in a World class manufacturing environment and highly automated installations.
cons: Uncompetitive salaries and devious management that did nothing to stop unethical individuals.

job_title: Lead Clerk of Administrative Services and Human Resources in Essex, MD
pros: Invested in my training and devopement
cons: Unorganized, Corporate Management is very rude.

pros: Good salary, good benefit, good career path
cons: Work/life balance need to be improved

pros: Competitive pay, bonuses  advancement opportunities
cons: May be required to work weekends or change shifts  sometimes on short notice

pros: Safety focus, good people at the plant

pros: Many opportunities and good work ambience

pros: Good Benefits, Nice people, and working towards improvement

pros: Excellent pay and benefits, great people

pros:

job_title: Shift Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
